<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/robinhood-lost-users-last-quarter-highlighting-the-end-of-the-meme-stock-glory-days?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Robinhood’s left holding the bag
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/robinhood-lost-users-last-quarter-highlighting-the-end-of-the-meme-stock-glory-days?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Robinhood illustration " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/aee338d1047d71515e9606ca653782797e1ab42f-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba </em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Earlier this week we wrote that the glory days of meme stocks appear to be over. Same goes for the trading app that propelled them to fame.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Robinhood stock fell 12% after hours Thursday when it revealed that it <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/27/robinhood-shares-tumble-9percent-after-first-quarter-revenue-forecast-is-well-below-estimates.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lost users</a> last quarter and projected Q1 revenue that left investors asking, “...that’s it?”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Investors have been asking lots of tough questions of the company recently. Robinhood’s stock has cratered 84% from its high last August. It was once valued at ~$60 billion; now, it’s worth less than $10 billion.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Sign of the times: </strong></span><span>Robinhood, which had been the king of the App Store, has fallen to #16 in the finance category alone. Even the </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/TheStalwart/status/1486810233477472259?s=20&t=BQ3PqaJSp47qqEv_SIhD4w" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">IRS app</a></span><span> is more popular.</span>
</li></ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">To explain what happened, let’s rewind</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One year ago today, Robinhood endured a level of internet wrath typically reserved for Pepsi commercials when it restricted trading on GameStop and other highly volatile stocks. After a period of confusion, CEO Vlad Tenev explained that the company didn’t have enough funds in reserves to support the much-larger trading volume it was experiencing.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While the trading pause was temporary, its effects still linger.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Robinhood was hit with lawsuits alleging the restrictions caused financial harm to individual traders, and paid out its first arbitration award earlier this month.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It also suffered significant reputational harm. Before January 28, 2021, it was seen as the champion of the individual trader—after, it was considered the bedfellow of Wall Street.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a recent <a href="https://blog.robinhood.com/news/2022/1/25/january-28-one-year-later?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">statement</a> on the events of last Jan. 28, Robinhood said it took several steps, including strengthening its net capital position and boosting its compliance and risk infrastructure, so that trading restrictions would never happen again.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>With stock and crypto prices fluctuating wildly each day in early 2021, the Robinhood app was appointment viewing for a new generation of individual investors. But the app has become less attractive now that meme stock mania has faded, markets are jittery over interest rate hikes, crypto prices are down, and hyperactive day trading has been partially replaced by “buy and hold” strategies, Bloomberg Opinion’s Jared Dillian <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2022-01-11/robinhood-has-become-an-attractive-takeover-target?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">notes</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>with a share price that’s in the dumps but also a large and desirable user base, Robinhood may become a takeover target, some analysts argue.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/gas-stoves-leak-when-off-study?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Now youre cookin’ with gas (in the bad way)
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/gas-stoves-leak-when-off-study?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="A gas stove editorial illustration." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/d971f9617b43600e8fb5f1b5a3df7de3c972da47-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Illustration: Dianna "Mick" McDougall; Source: Lew Robertson/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Much like that TikTok feta pasta recipe you completely botched, your gas-powered stove may be more damaging than it looks. A Stanford University study published Thursday found that gas stoves leak <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-27/americans-gas-stoves-are-as-bad-for-climate-as-500-00-cars?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">significant amounts</a> of methane even when turned off, contributing more to global warming than previously thought.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, the study measured the emissions of 53 gas stoves and found that around 80% of the appliances’ methane leaks happen when they’re turned off. The age and brand of the stove didn’t have a noticeable impact on its leaking potential, either.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So why does it matter? Well, for a few reasons:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gas stoves send about 2.6 million tons of methane into the atmosphere each year, the study found.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Methane contributes far more to global warming than carbon dioxide in the atmosphere (around 80x more, in fact, although it doesn’t linger as long).</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nitrogen dioxide, which can trigger asthma and other respiratory issues, also leaks from gas stoves.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">A little perspective:</strong> With around 40 million gas stoves in the US, researchers estimate that the appliances have the same effect on climate change as about 500,000 cars (there are at least 250 million registered cars in the country). Researchers suggest switching to an electric stove, or having a professional tighten your gas stove’s connectors.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TELECOM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/fcc-nutrition-labels-internet-services?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
How much sodium is in your wi-fi?
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/fcc-nutrition-labels-internet-services?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Sample nutrition label from FCC" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/d3a5b3ab5c1029afc7a78c2c78eed86685158ae4-1920x1080.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>FCC's 2016 example.</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Our internet services are about to get the same treatment as a Ritz cracker. The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/technology/591645-fcc-approves-internet-nutrition-label-proposal?rl=1" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">voted</a> unanimously yesterday to require the Comcasts and Verizons of the world to create broadband “nutrition labels” that lay out cost, speed, and data allowances of internet offerings more clearly for consumers as early as November.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The goal is to 1) provide more transparency so consumers don’t get an extra $40 surprise on their bill and 2) make it easier for them to compare different providers.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The United States Telecom Association, which represents telecommunications-related businesses in the US, said in a statement before the vote that it agrees people should have clear info about services, but…“they already do.” The organization urged the FCC not to create rules that burden providers. </span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out.</strong> Efforts to demystify internet provider language have been made since the Obama administration, when voluntary broadband nutrition labels were introduced in 2016 and then put on ice. This mandatory label rehaul was launched as part of President Biden’s July executive order that aimed to increase competition in concentrated industries like airlines, agriculture, and tech.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>HBO</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> The US economy accelerated at its <a href="https://www.axios.com/gdp-growth-surges-fourth-quarter-4144b0a3-5423-4f5a-b108-acc51d27390d.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fastest pace</a> in 37 years in 2021, capped off by a Q4 in which annualized GDP grew a very nice 6.9% (much higher than the 5.3% projected). Even with this blistering recovery, the economy remains about 1% below levels that had been predicted before the pandemic hit.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“Never forget.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those words rang out <a href="https://apnews.com/article/2022-international-holocaust-remembrance-day-58c7a1864907d9a80762a20d3c960487?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">across the world</a> yesterday as leaders, survivors, and communities marked International Holocaust Remembrance Day. The commemoration was punctuated by news that a Tennessee school board <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/maus-pulitzer-prize-winning-book-holocaust-pulled-tennessee-school-dis-rcna13730?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">removed</a> the Pulitzer Prize-winning graphic novel about the Holocaust, <em>Maus</em>, from its curriculum due to adult content.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Embracing habit in an automated world. (<a href="https://harpers.org/archive/2022/01/routine-maintenance-embracing-habit-in-an-automated-world-meghan-ogieblyn/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Harper’s Magazine</a>)</p>
</div>

GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Your friend chooses a random card from a standard deck of 52 cards, and keeps this card hidden. You have to guess which of the 52 cards it is.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Before your guess, you can ask your friend one of the following three questions:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Is the card red?</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Is the card a face card? (Jack, Queen, or King)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Is the card the ace of spades?</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Your friend will answer truthfully. What question would you ask that gives you the best chance of guessing the correct card?</p>
</div>

style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarlier this week we wrote that the glory days of meme stocks appear to be over. Same goes for the trading app that propelled them to fame.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRobinhood stock fell 12% after hours Thursday when it revealed that it \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/27/robinhood-shares-tumble-9percent-after-first-quarter-revenue-forecast-is-well-below-estimates.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elost users\u003c/a\u003e last quarter and projected Q1 revenue that left investors asking, “...that’s it?”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInvestors have been asking lots of tough questions of the company recently. Robinhood’s stock has cratered 84% from its high last August. It was once valued at ~$60 billion; now, it’s worth less than $10 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSign of the times: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRobinhood, which had been the king of the App Store, has fallen to #16 in the finance category alone. Even the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/TheStalwart/status/1486810233477472259?s=20\u0026t=BQ3PqaJSp47qqEv_SIhD4w\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eIRS app\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e is more popular.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTo explain what happened, let’s rewind\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne year ago today, Robinhood endured a level of internet wrath typically reserved for Pepsi commercials when it restricted trading on GameStop and other highly volatile stocks. After a period of confusion, CEO Vlad Tenev explained that the company didn’t have enough funds in reserves to support the much-larger trading volume it was experiencing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile the trading pause was temporary, its effects still linger.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRobinhood was hit with lawsuits alleging the restrictions caused financial harm to individual traders, and paid out its first arbitration award earlier this month.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt also suffered significant reputational harm. Before January 28, 2021, it was seen as the champion of the individual trader—after, it was considered the bedfellow of Wall Street.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a recent \u003ca href=\"https://blog.robinhood.com/news/2022/1/25/january-28-one-year-later?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estatement\u003c/a\u003e on the events of last Jan. 28, Robinhood said it took several steps, including strengthening its net capital position and boosting its compliance and risk infrastructure, so that trading restrictions would never happen again.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eWith stock and crypto prices fluctuating wildly each day in early 2021, the Robinhood app was appointment viewing for a new generation of individual investors. But the app has become less attractive now that meme stock mania has faded, markets are jittery over interest rate hikes, crypto prices are down, and hyperactive day trading has been partially replaced by “buy and hold” strategies, Bloomberg Opinion’s Jared Dillian \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2022-01-11/robinhood-has-become-an-attractive-takeover-target?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enotes\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ewith a share price that’s in the dumps but also a large and desirable user base, Robinhood may become a takeover target, some analysts argue.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nNow youre cookin’ with gas (in the bad way)\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/gas-stoves-leak-when-off-study?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A gas stove editorial illustration.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/d971f9617b43600e8fb5f1b5a3df7de3c972da47-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eIllustration: Dianna \"Mick\" McDougall; Source: Lew Robertson/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMuch like that TikTok feta pasta recipe you completely botched, your gas-powered stove may be more damaging than it looks. A Stanford University study published Thursday found that gas stoves leak \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-01-27/americans-gas-stoves-are-as-bad-for-climate-as-500-00-cars?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esignificant amounts\u003c/a\u003e of methane even when turned off, contributing more to global warming than previously thought.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn fact, the study measured the emissions of 53 gas stoves and found that around 80% of the appliances’ methane leaks happen when they’re turned off. The age and brand of the stove didn’t have a noticeable impact on its leaking potential, either.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo why does it matter? Well, for a few reasons:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGas stoves send about 2.6 million tons of methane into the atmosphere each year, the study found.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMethane contributes far more to global warming than carbon dioxide in the atmosphere (around 80x more, in fact, although it doesn’t linger as long).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNitrogen dioxide, which can trigger asthma and other respiratory issues, also leaks from gas stoves.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA little perspective:\u003c/strong\u003e With around 40 million gas stoves in the US, researchers estimate that the appliances have the same effect on climate change as about 500,000 cars (there are at least 250 million registered cars in the country). Researchers suggest switching to an electric stove, or having a professional tighten your gas stove’s connectors.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOur internet services are about to get the same treatment as a Ritz cracker. The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/technology/591645-fcc-approves-internet-nutrition-label-proposal?rl=1\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evoted\u003c/a\u003e unanimously yesterday to require the Comcasts and Verizons of the world to create broadband “nutrition labels” that lay out cost, speed, and data allowances of internet offerings more clearly for consumers as early as November.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe goal is to 1) provide more transparency so consumers don’t get an extra $40 surprise on their bill and 2) make it easier for them to compare different providers.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe United States Telecom Association, which represents telecommunications-related businesses in the US, said in a statement before the vote that it agrees people should have clear info about services, but…“they already do.” The organization urged the FCC not to create rules that burden providers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out.\u003c/strong\u003e Efforts to demystify internet provider language have been made since the Obama administration, when voluntary broadband nutrition labels were introduced in 2016 and then put on ice. This mandatory label rehaul was launched as part of President Biden’s July executive order that aimed to increase competition in concentrated industries like airlines, agriculture, and tech.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
